thread.title: Gautier joins effort to challenge current FEMA flood maps
thread.title_full: Gautier joins effort to challenge current FEMA flood maps - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Gautier joins effort to challenge current FEMA flood maps
text:
GAUTIER, Miss. (AP) - Gautier officials have adopted a resolution to urge the Mississippi Legislature to appropriate $1.5 million to further a combined effort of the three coastal counties to obtain more accurate and consistent flood zone mapping.
The Mississippi Press reports ( http://bit.ly/1kuv1L0 ) the resolution approved Tuesday states current flood maps are flawed, inconsistent from community to community, and need to be studied and redrawn.
Officials say the money would go to the Southern Mississippi Planning and Development District to coordinate attempts to mitigate the negative impacts of the Biggert-Waters Flood Insurance Reform Act of 2012 and challenge current maps being used by FEMA.
Mayor Gordon Gollott says the issue impacts everyone who lives along the Gulf Coast, especially in the flood zones.
Information from: The Mississippi Press, http://www.gulflive.com
